meanings.definition: An offensive term for a contemptible or despicable person.
meanings.sent1: That suckhole always tries to ruin our fun.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the student for calling someone a suckhole.
meanings.sent3: I can't believe he acted like such a suckhole at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her behavior was a black hole of suckholery.
meanings.sent5: The bully's actions painted him as a true suckhole.

meanings.definition: A hole or opening through which something is sucked or drained.
meanings.sent1: The sink had a clogged suckhole that needed fixing.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner's suckhole was powerful enough to pick up small objects.
meanings.sent3: The straw's suckhole was too small to drink the thick milkshake.
meanings.sent4: The whirlpool acted like a giant suckhole in the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The tornado's powerful suckhole sucked up everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To suck or draw in with the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The baby would suckhole on her pacifier for comfort.
meanings.sent2: He had to suckhole the venom out of the snakebite to save his friend.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner started to suckhole up all the dirt on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The black hole seemed to suckhole everything into its depths.
meanings.sent5: The straw could easily suckhole up the refreshing drink.
